item.title: Video Game Hardware Sales Slightly Increase In November 2024 Thanks To PS5 Pro
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/video-game-hardware-sales-slightly-increase-in-november-2024-thanks-to-ps5-pro/

Video game hardware sales in the United States (US) slightly increased in November 2024. That’s according to the latest sales data from Circana.

For November 2024, video game hardware spending increased by 0.3$ from $924 million (M) to $927M year-over-year. That’s a major change from October’s numbers which saw a 23% year-over-year fall.

Unlike October 2024, where a decrease in sales was across the board, November was a bit different. Thanks to the launch of the PlayStation 5 (PS5) Pro and its $700 price tag, the PS5 saw a 15% increase in overall spending. On the other side of things, however, the Nintendo Switch say a 3% year-over-year drop in sales while the Xbox fell 29%.

Going back to the PS5, the PS5 Pro made up 19% of the number of PS5 consoles sold in November while also accounting for 28% of the money. That’s a 12% decrease in launch month sales of the PS4 Pro, but a 50% increase in dollars. The PS4 Pro launched at $400 in 2016 compared to the aforementioned $700 of the PS5 Pro.

RELATED: College Football 25 Remains 2024’s Best-Selling Video Game

In total for 2024, hardware sales in the US have fallen 24% to $3.74 billion (B) from the $4.9B in 2023. In terms of general units, 2.4M consoles were sold in November 2024 compared to the 2.3M sold in November 2023. That brings the total number of consoles sold for 2024 up to 9.4M, down compared to the 11.7M sold by this time in 2023.

That said, accessories continue to perform better than a year ago. In total, accessory sales rose 4% in November year-over-year while the year-to-date numbers jumped 8%. According to the data, the PlayStation Portal remains the best-selling accessory both for November 2024 and the entire year.

item.title: College Football 25 Remains 2024’s Best-Selling Video Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/college-football-25-remains-2024s-best-selling-video-game/

Despite a push from Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, College Football 25 remains 2024 best-selling video game. According to the latest data from Circana, it remained at the top despite a push from Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

Since its release in July, College Football 25 has remained at the top of the list. When it launched, it knocked Helldivers 2 from the spot, and has yet to give it up.

The good news doesn’t stop their for EA Sports, either. It was also revealed that College Football 25 has passed NBA 2K21 to become the best-selling sports game in US history. It’s even entered the top 50 best-selling games of all time in dollars.

RELATED: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Was November’s Best-Selling Video Game

Elsewhere on the chart, Black Ops 6 moved from third to second, bumping Helldivers 2 down one spot. Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 also made a jump to 20, knocking Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League out.

item.title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Was November’s Best-Selling Video Game
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-was-novembers-best-selling-video-game/

For the second month in a row, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 was the best-selling video game in the United States for November 2024. Per the latest data from Circana, Black Ops 6 remained at the top after also being the best-selling game in October.

Following Black Ops 6 up front were Madden 25, EA Sports FC 25, College Football 25 and Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero at two through five, respectively.

As far as the entire top 20 list, three made their debut after releasing between November 3-30. The debuting games include Mario & Luigi: Brothership, Dragon Quest 3, and My Sims: Cozy Bundle. Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 and Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics also re-joined the top 20 after being on the outside for October.

RELATED: College Football 25 Remains 2024’s Best-Selling Video Game

With five games either returning or debuting in the list, that means games had to leave. Falling out of the top 20 for November were Elden Ring, Life is Strange: Double Exposure, NHL 25, Finial Fantasy I-VI Bundle, and The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Celebrates 20 Million Players With a Free Reward
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-celebrates-20-million-players-with-a-free-reward/

Marvel Rivals, Netease’s new free-to-play hero shooter, has been a massive success, attracting over 20 million players within the first two weeks. 

The official Marvel Rivals X account revealed that 20 million players have joined the game. As a token of their gratitude, the developers are offering a free reward to the community. If players log in between December 20, 2024, and January 10, 2025, they can grab a free spray that features the 20 million milestone. 

Marvel Rivals, released on December 6, 2024, was surprisingly quick to hit the 20 million milestone. The game has been making waves since its release, pulling in 10 million players within the first three days. 

Marvel Rivals features a massive roster of characters, with several iconic heroes and villains from Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy, X-Men, and more joining the fray. It features fast-paced 6v6 action where players must strategize together to combine their powers and turn the tide in their favour. The game also features iconic maps such as Asgard, Tokyo 2099, Intergalactic Empire of Wakanda: Hall of Djalia, and more.

item.title: Tarkov Pre-Wipe Event Gives Cultists Marked Keys and 100% Spawn Rates
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/tarkov-new-pre-wipe-event-cultists/

Battlestate Games has rolled out another pre-wipe event for Escape from Tarkov, introducing a 100% spawn rate (at night) for Cultists across their main maps: Shoreline, Customs, and Woods. The latest update has equipped many of these Cultists with Marked Keys, which as you might know, open doors to some of the most high-value locations in the game.

Most recently, players were tackling a pre-wipe event in Escape from Tarkov that required them to kill 30 enemies on the Factory map to unlock Kappa, one of the most sought-after items in the game.

Kill Cultists, Make Gains

This latest pre-wipe event for Tarkov comes with the following description on social media:

The losses of both PMC factions during night-time operations have increased. The old-timers believe that this is due to the pilgrimage of the so-called “witnesses” to their marked circles.

There are reports of many of those hooded people carrying marked keys. Despite the increased danger, PMCs are now preparing for night raids and taking advantage of the fact that Mechanic started selling NVGs at a great discount.

Now, the large maps that accommodate Cultists (so, not Ground Zero or Factory) will have a 100% spawn rate for the faction at night only. Also, Mechanic has massively discounted NVGs like the GPNVG-18, which is selling for just 43,000 roubles at the moment.

When you kill Cultists, you’ll have a solid chance of picking up a range of Marked Keys from their bodies, which you can then turn into some great loot. Bear in mind that you’ll be competing with thousands of other players to access these locations, though.

As expected, this pre-wipe event is only available for PvP players, because the game’s PvE mode doesn’t accommodate forced wipes, so a pre-wipe event doesn’t make much sense.

As a bonus, you can secure Cultist Knives and trade them with Mechanic for coloured keycards.

It’s expected that the next Escape from Tarkov wipe will arrive around Christmas. Are you ready? Let us know on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Amazon’s ‘Secret Level’ Has Been Renewed for a Second Season
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/secret-level-season-2/

Amazon’s game-inspired animated anthology Secret Level has been renewed for a second season.

First reported by Variety, Secret Level was Amazon’s most-watched animated series debut of all time, with an estimated 155.3 million minutes watched in the US alone, equalling around 1.4 million full 109-minute views.

The outlet reports that although the series has been renewed for a second season, the games that will be covered are a closely-guarded secret for the moment.

Season 1 of Secret Level included Dungeons and Dragons, Sifu, Pac-Man, Armored Core, The Outer Worlds, Concord, and more. The series’ cast included a star-studded cast, including Arnold Schwarzenegger, Kevin Hart, Keanu Reeves, Temuera Morrison, Ariana Greenblatt, Heaven Hart, Emily Swallow, Gabriel Luna, Ricky Whittle, Patrick Schwarzenegger, Merle Dandridge, Claudia Doumit, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje, Clive Standen, Laura Bailey and Michael Beach.

It’s said that series creator Tim Miller, who also directed the first Deadpool movie will continue for Season 2.
